reviews.review_text: I don't get to experience the nostalgia others will get but on it's own, even as of 2015, this game is so much fun.  The graphics are cute, it's fairly difficult and the micromanagment involved is just the right amount to not overshadow the combat that takes place every now and then.   The unit sizes that you start with could change depending on the unit size setting you have selected, but i'll just mark it down as immersion.   Any total war fan fed up with the current bug riddled and incomplete games will find solace in this gem.

I was just left agape when I saw this on Steam.  If you're looking for a modern Total War game then this isn't it, but if you want a fantastic game from the past then here it is!  I must have logged over 2000 hours when I had this game as a kid! I'm gonna try to break that number if I can!  10/10
Awesome game. Its like any other TW game but different in that its like a board game. Definitely has a very unique feel to it and a must for any TW fan out there

Finally!!! Creative Assembly's best total war product ever (my opinion) and my first...  Although the graphics are....well....give me a piece of paper and I can make those birds that flap around durring battles. Still though, a very well-thoughtout gem of a game that can beat some of the other titles as far as gameplay is concerned.  Some of my favorite features: The crusades and Jihads are massive You freely give titles of lordship at will Marry within the family  --> ACTUALL freakin' civil wars <-- Somewhat more competent AI than the others (but I think it has to do with the simplicity of the game mechanics like the map being made of regions instead of a free-roaming world) An amazing soundtrack.  I hear there are mods but I have no idea if those still work. Best place to check would be at  TWcenter.net  (HUGE modding community)  Best $9.99 I've spend this month...

first for all those people that have problems, i've been playing full games with no crashing. i set the game to windows compat. mode XP service pack 3. i change the rez of the game map and battle map to fit my desktop rez. i run the program as an administrator and you can't launch the game from steam. you have to go to the Medieval_TW.exe in your steam files and launch it. also quick saves can corrupt save game files so only (Esc button) saves work. also the battles may also cause crashing. try not to play the battle just auto resolve. i run windows 7 and don't have any problems after two games.  -The story this is the first total war i have ever played. this game brings me back to when i had a pci (not pci E) graphics card slot and couldn't play this game on my dell (agp card slots were the fastest at that time). i would read the manual in math class looking at the cool units and campaign map. how the 3D'ish battles worked and looked. then i would go home and look at the intro to the game just for it to crash as i hit start a new game. i wanted to play it so bad and after begging my mother at comp USA to get me a better card my dell could finally play the game (i was 14 i think). my first time going into the campaign map was just as the manual had explained. a chess like setup with 3D'ish battles and with whole armys I MADE. never before had a game stood out to me as being a real commanding game. i would say if you can stand the graphics then get this game to feel like a true military commander and statesman.

Pure, Distilled Total War ---------- If you like total war, but never played these older 2D games then Medieval and Shogun are a must try. Keep in mind Total War was a VERY different game before Rome: much simpler; almost board game-like rules where your objective is singular: conquer the map before time runs out. Build buildings in your provinces to get money and units, give titles to your generals to boost their stats, recruit agents to to your dirty work, fight battles to conquer everyone else, that's it. Very easy to pick up and go, and next thing you know you've been up all night playing.

Best game ever. This game started my gaming 'addiction' without it I would probably be playing COD on the console instead of good games on PC.  While this game is obviously 'worse' than the newer Total War games it still is a load of fun for anyone who enjoys strategy.

Best Total war game besides maybe Rome 1. Good ai, graphics though dated have that great nostalgia to it; it feels like EU4 with the total war simulation. I spent thousands of hours playing this as a kid. This game dates before CA began to ♥♥♥♥ everything up.   Even better, this version runs on later systems no problems. :)   £6.99 is a steal to be honest; you get a vast amount of content. Weird to think how this early gem has in some cases better content then the likes of Rome 2 and Attila. CA, get your act together.

My favorite Total War game. I prefer the classic user interface and the straightforward strategy to the new Total War games. If you are looking for a simple strategy experience, this is the game for you.

The only Total War game I ever really enjoyed, after this ones they made added too much micro management of cities, provinces and people.  The game is now outdated and looks it, but the game play and combat is more fun than any of the sequals. I know a lot of people myself included experience a lot of crashes to desktop, but after a quick google search there is a solution for most people, turn down the resolution from max (or something like that) and the crashes stop....at least they did for me and a lot of other people.  So if you feel nostalgic and want to play a total war game for a reasonable price, without having to micro manage too much then give it another go, it may bring back happy memories, but at the very least it won't annoy you like all the sequals do.
BUY THIS GAME!!! OR ILL SEND MY BLOOD THIRSTY HOUND AFTER YOU...
IT ACTUALLY WORKS !!!!

A true classic, a must have. Yes, it is old. Yes, the graphics of the RTS part is awful. But yes, it still is a great game. The infinite possibilities of moulding history to your liking, the unique bond you develop with your generals and their equally unique stories and traits, the purely Medieval feeling of your chess-like TBS map... For me, it is also the memories: Medieval was my first Total War, my first strategy game on PC, and the beginning of an age. I can't recount all the hours spent in front of it when I was a child with a weird taste in games, who enjoyed conquering the world a lot more than making weird animals jump over wooden crates (yes, mr. Bandicoot, I'm talking to you).  PS Don't be confused by my scarce gameplay time - I used to own a retail version and I totally played the heck out of it for years and years!

I've been playing this game since it came out, and I was extremely happy when it came to steam, 'fixed' for newer systems. It took me couple of hours to figure out that it has not actually been fixed, as crashes are still commonplace, and gamebreaking when they involve AI moves that can't be avoided.  I cannot get a refund because it seemed to work perfectly for the first few hours, so leaving a review is the best I can do. I hope the devs fix the game, but it has been months since release and I haven't heard anything from them. Please save yourself the money until they fix it.  Edit:  All of this was true until Blandy suggested I change the resolution. Since then, I have been running with campaign map resolution of 1024 X 768, and I have yet to experience a single crash. To clarify, I am using Windows 7 64 bit. I am able to fight massive battles without any difficulty whatsoever.

Oh yes! Awesome game -- shedloads of atmosphere, efficient risk-style strat-map, tactical battles where your decisions count, city-management, political intrigue, leaders who can be gay, straight, or marry their sister. And Vikings too. Somehow I prefer this morbid medieval saga to the later Total War games ... it's got character.
One of the best Total Wars. AI is unreal. Music is great. Atmosphere fantastic. Only complaint is the lag experienced by newer graphics cards. Switching to intel inetegrated graphics fixed it though.
Like a fine wine this game has aged well. It still offers a deep game play experience that will suck you in for hours on end.
this is one of my favorite games of all time. yet it crashes on me constantly i really wish they would fix this.

This game is a Dream come true for MTW, and Total War fans. Everything is as it was, incredible soundtrack, bloody battles, triumphant victories and those generals and moments you feel so proud fighting in/with. If you like total war games, this one may be old but it NEVER lost its spark. Get it!   (Game may crash if settings arent turned to default low 800/600) But i havent had problems so far. *Running Windows 8.1*

I think this is the best Total War game produced, though it have some little niggles here and there, especially in the real time battles. What sets it apart from other TW games that came after it, in my opinion, is the grand strategy aspect of the game. Although graphics is dated, especially in the real time battles, this is an excellent game to waste hundreds and hundreds of hours on. Highly recommended for any strategy game fan.
Constant crashes makes the game unplayable. The short moments between crashes are great. I really hope they fix the crashes.
Loved this game, loved it. So happy that I can now play it on Win8. Not the least bit impressed that I played for over an hour this evening only to have the game crash with no chance of saving.

As much as I would love to recommend this game, I cannot. It gave me hours upon hours of enjoyment, being the game that really got me hooked on games, and I truly wished to be able to enjoy the steam version. Alas, it was not to be. The steam version is completely unstable, I do recall the game crashing with a certain consistency, but they were often due to me playing for too long. The crashes now are often when you end a turn, start a battle, or just try to launch the game. I am greatly disappointed with the state of this game that I love so dearly.

Medieval: Total War is an amazing game, but in the state it currently is in I cannot recommend it.  I began with no issues. The game runs well and is incredibly fun to play, but at around hour 2 I experienced a crash that brought me very far back in the campaign. Then I played more, ignoring the warnings I saw on the page regarding crashes. 3 crashes later and I can no longer ignore it.
This game always crashes after a certain point in the campaign. This often happens befor large battles. Loading up an old save does not help as it just crashes again when the same point is reached

DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.  I love this game but on Win 10 it reaches a certain point in a game then you CTD, even if you reload the last save the game will CTD again as soon as you end that turn. To say it's frustrating is a massive understatment. I currently have 4 game saves that are all in limbo as when I end the next turn they all CTD.   It's not even worth the £1.74 I paid in a sale.
Game ending crashes. Constant game ending crashes that prevent any progress.
good old game as i remember , ma not compatiple whit w7 , so I lost my money. Continuous crash does not allow you to play
